title: Heat Lamp and Heat Plate Differences | Cackle Hatchery

tasks.task: Caring for mail-order baby chicks upon arrival at home.
subtasks: Choosing appropriate heat lamp (125 watts per 25 chicks).
Maintaining temperature at 100-105 degrees at floor level.
Monitoring chicks' behavior to adjust heat as needed.
Transitioning to lower-heat sources after 7-10 days.
Providing proper heat source (lamp) for two days of transit effects.
Adjusting temperature based on chicks' activities (huddling, sleeping, spacing).
Upgrading to non-light-producing heat sources after initial period.
Monitoring and adjusting heat gradually over time.
